title: Heavy rainfalls expected in parts of the island today
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that the atmospheric conditions are getting favorable for afternoon thundershowers in the most parts of the island for next few days from today (01).

title: Price of milk tea increased
byline: The price of a cup of milk tea has been increase by Rs. 10, the All-Island Restaurant Owners’ Association announced.

title: Fire at Tesla dealership near Rome destroys 17 cars
byline: At least 17 Tesla cars were destroyed after a fire broke out at a dealership on the outskirts of Rome on Monday morning, according to Italian fire officials. No one was at the dealership when the fire broke out and no injuries have been reported.

title: New tax regulations take effect from today
byline: The Inland Revenue Department has announced that individuals earning less than Rs. 1.8 million annually can now claim relief on the advance income tax (AIT) charged on interest or discounts from deposits.

title: Three Bangladeshis arrested at BIA in attempt to illegally migrate to Greece
byline: Three Bangladeshi nationals have been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport in Katunayake while attempting to travel to Greece using forged Greek residence visas.

title: Second phase of first school term begins
byline: The Ministry of Education says that the second phase of the first school term of academic year 2025 in all government schools and government-approved private schools will commence today (01).

title: NPP govt. will definitely introduce new constitution – Justice Minister
byline: Minister of Justice and National Integration Attorney-at-Law Harshana Nanayakkara reaffirmed that introducing a new constitution and abolishing the executive presidency will be key priorities under the National People’s Power (NPP) government.

title: Sri Lanka to dispatch medical team to assist Myanmar earthquake victims
byline: The Ministry of Health announced that Sri Lanka is prepared to dispatch a medical team to Myanmar to assist those affected by the recent earthquake.

title: Japan estimates feared megaquake could cause $1.8 trln in damage, kill 300,000 people
byline: Japan’s economy could lose as much as $1.81 trillion in the event of a long-anticipated megaquake off its Pacific coast, which could trigger devastating tsunamis, the collapse of hundreds of buildings and potentially killing about 300,000 people, a government report said on Monday.

title: Multiple-vehicle collision on expressway
byline: A major accident has occurred near the 25.5 km mark on the Dodangoda-Galanigama Expressway, involving multiple vehicles.

title: MP Chamara Sampath brought to court
byline: Parliamentarian Chamara Sampath Dassanayake was brought before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (01) in connection with three corruption-related cases.

title: ‘Adolescence’ hard to watch as a dad, UK Prime Minister tells creators
byline: The prime minister has told the makers of hit Netflix drama Adolescence that it was “really hard to watch” with his teenage children, as he hosted a Downing Street meeting to discuss the influence of toxic material online.

title: Korean star Kim Soo-Hyun denies accusations by late actress’ family
byline: South Korean star Kim Soo-hyun has made a tearful public statement denying allegations made by the family of actress Kim Sae-ron, who died in an apparent suicide in February.

title: Ex-Minister S. Viyalendiran further remanded
byline: Former Minister Sathasivam Viyalendiran has been ordered to be further remanded until April 8 after being produced before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court.

title: Six hospitalised after fire on Malaysia gas pipeline, among 33 hurt
byline: A fire at a gas pipeline operated by Malaysia state energy firm Petronas injured 33 people on Tuesday (April 1) on the outskirts of the capital Kuala Lumpur, authorities said.

title: Sri Lanka vigilant as seismic activity increases in the region
byline: While recent earthquakes have not directly impacted Sri Lanka, the Geological Survey & Mines Bureau has urged authorities and the public to remain vigilant regarding seismic activity in the region.

title: No changes to three-wheeler fares despite fuel price reduction
byline: The Western Province Three-Wheeler Drivers’ and Owners’ Association has stated that despite the reduction of fuel prices, there is no possibility of making any changes to the three-wheeler fares.

title: Financial aid for children of families affected by human-elephant conflict
byline: The Board of Control of the President’s Fund, which met under the chairmanship of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, has decided to introduce a new financial assistance program to support children from families affected by wild elephant attacks,...

title: ‘SF Sarath’ sentenced to death over 2014 killing, ‘Dematagoda Chaminda’ acquitted
byline: The Colombo High Court has sentenced to death underworld figure K.M. Sarath Bandara, also known as ‘SF Sarath’, who was found guilty of shooting and killing a man in the Borella area in 2014.

title: MP Chamara Sampath further remanded
byline: MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake has been ordered to be remanded further until April 08, 2025.
